properties.instructions:
Fetch and analyze uptime data from an API status page.
    Use @browser-text to get the page content.

    Guidelines:
    1. Visit the provided status page URL
    2. Find the specified service's uptime information
    3. Extract the most recent uptime percentage available
    4. Return just the percentage as a number between 0 and 100

    Focus on finding the most recent uptime data available.
    This could be daily, weekly, monthly or any other time period shown.

messages.content:
<instructions>

    Fetch and analyze uptime data from an API status page.
    Use @browser-text to get the page content.

    Guidelines:
    1. Visit the provided status page URL
    2. Find the specified service's uptime information
    3. Extract the most recent uptime percentage available
    4. Return just the percentage as a number between 0 and 100

    Focus on finding the most recent uptime data available.
    This could be daily, weekly, monthly or any other time period shown.
    
</instructions>

Input will be provided in the user message using a JSON following the schema:
```json
{
  "description": "Input for checking API uptime.",
  "properties": {
    "status_page_url": {
      "description": "URL of the status page to check",
      "examples": [
        "https://status.openai.com",
        "https://status.anthropic.com"
      ],
      "type": "string"
    },
    "service_name": {
      "description": "Name of the specific API service to check",
      "examples": [
        "API",
        "Chat Completions",
        "Embeddings"
      ],
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "status_page_url",
    "service_name"
  ],
  "type": "object"
}
```

Before actually computing the output, you can use the following tools to help you:
<tools_list>
    <tool>
        <tool_name>@browser-text</tool_name>
        <tool_description>Browses the URL passed as argument and extracts the web page content in markdown format.</tool_description>
        <tool_input_schema>
        ```json
        {"type": "object", "properties": {"url": {"type": "string"}}, "required": ["url"], "description": "Input for the '@browser-text' tool"}
        ```
        </tool_input_schema>
        <tool_output_schema>
        ```json
        {"type": "string"}
        ```
        </tool_output_schema>
    </tool>
</tools_list>

Once you have received the answer from the tools, if needed, you can compute the output. But if there are tools calls in your answer, you do not need to compute the task output.
Do not retry failed tool calls.

<instructions>

    Fetch and analyze uptime data from an API status page.
    Use @browser-text to get the page content.

    Guidelines:
    1. Visit the provided status page URL
    2. Find the specified service's uptime information
    3. Extract the most recent uptime percentage available
    4. Return just the percentage as a number between 0 and 100

    Focus on finding the most recent uptime data available.
    This could be daily, weekly, monthly or any other time period shown.
    
</instructions>

Input will be provided in the user message using a JSON following the schema:
```json
{
  "description": "Input for checking API uptime.",
  "properties": {
    "status_page_url": {
      "description": "URL of the status page to check",
      "examples": [
        "https://status.openai.com",
        "https://status.anthropic.com"
      ],
      "type": "string"
    },
    "service_name": {
      "description": "Name of the specific API service to check",
      "examples": [
        "API",
        "Chat Completions",
        "Embeddings"
      ],
      "type": "string"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "status_page_url",
    "service_name"
  ],
  "type": "object"
}
```

Before actually computing the output, you can use the following tools to help you:
<tools_list>
    <tool>
        <tool_name>@browser-text</tool_name>
        <tool_description>Browses the URL passed as argument and extracts the web page content in markdown format.</tool_description>
        <tool_input_schema>
        ```json
        {"type": "object", "properties": {"url": {"type": "string"}}, "required": ["url"], "description": "Input for the '@browser-text' tool"}
        ```
        </tool_input_schema>
        <tool_output_schema>
        ```json
        {"type": "string"}
        ```
        </tool_output_schema>
    </tool>
</tools_list>

Once you have received the answer from the tools, if needed, you can compute the output. But if there are tools calls in your answer, you do not need to compute the task output.
Do not retry failed tool calls.

Return a single JSON object enforcing the following schema:
```json
{
  "description": "Output containing uptime percentage.",
  "properties": {
    "internal_agent_run_result": {
      "default": null,
      "description": "The status of the agent run, needs to be filled whether the run was successful or not",
      "$ref": "#/$defs/AgentRunResult"
    },
    "internal_tool_calls": {
      "description": "The list of tool calls to execute, before being able to compute the task output",
      "items": {
        "$ref": "#/$defs/ToolCall"
      },
      "title": "Internal Tool Calls",
      "type": "array"
    },
    "uptime_percentage": {
      "description": "The uptime percentage for the specified service over the last 30 days",
      "examples": [
        99.99,
        98.5
      ],
      "maximum": 100.0,
      "minimum": 0.0,
      "type": "number"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "uptime_percentage"
  ],
  "type": "object",
  "$defs": {
    "ToolCall": {
      "properties": {
        "tool_name": {
          "description": "The name of the tool called",
          "title": "Tool Name",
          "type": "string",
          "enum": [
            "@browser-text"
          ]
        },
        "tool_input_dict": {
          "description": "The input of the tool call",
          "title": "Tool Input Dict",
          "anyOf": [
            {
              "type": "object",
              "properties": {
                "url": {
                  "type": "string"
                }
              },
              "required": [
                "url"
              ],
              "description": "Input for the '@browser-text' tool"
            }
          ]
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "tool_name",
        "tool_input_dict"
      ],
      "title": "ToolCall",
      "type": "object"
    },
    "AgentRunError": {
      "properties": {
        "error_code": {
          "default": null,
          "description": "The type of error that occurred during the agent run, 'tool_call_error' if an error occurred during a tool call, 'missing_tool' if the agent is missing a tool in order to complete the run, 'other' for any other error",
          "title": "Error Code",
          "enum": [
            "tool_call_error",
            "missing_tool",
            "other"
          ],
          "type": "string"
        },
        "error_message": {
          "default": null,
          "description": "A summary of the error that occurred during the agent run",
          "title": "Error Message",
          "type": "string"
        }
      },
      "title": "AgentRunError",
      "type": "object"
    },
    "AgentRunResult": {
      "properties": {
        "status": {
          "default": null,
          "description": "Whether the agent run was successful or not",
          "title": "Status",
          "enum": [
            "success",
            "failure"
          ],
          "type": "string"
        },
        "error": {
          "default": null,
          "description": "The error that occurred during the agent run, to fill in case of status='failure'",
          "$ref": "#/$defs/AgentRunError"
        }
      },
      "title": "AgentRunResult",
      "type": "object"
    }
  }
}
```
